docs.lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Anne Walsh, a daughter of Thomas J. Walsh of Cranford, N.J., and the late Susan Bermingham Walsh, was married on Friday to Edward Michael Giblin, a son of Mary Katherine Giblin and Thomas P. Giblin of Montclair, N.J. The Rev. William Sheridan, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Immaculate Conception Chapel at Seton Hall University in South Orange, N.J.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Looking for Answers When Choosing Care'' (July 2) struck a personal chord with me.
docs.abstract: Joseph Ellis and Anne Trinkle letters on July 2 article on choosing hospitals and doctors for cancer, heart and other serious ailments
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     ''Looking for Answers When Choosing Care'' (July 2) struck a personal chord with me.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Looking for Answers When Choosing Care'' (July 2) struck a personal chord with me. When my wife learned she had breast cancer, we decided that the highest quality of care would be provided at Memorial Sloan-Kettering. We were impressed with the understanding and sensitivity of the staff, and the support services provided. But most important, the collective knowledge exhibited by the staff and the exemplary quality of medical services met our best expectations.
docs.abstract: Joseph Ellis and Anne Trinkle letters on July 2 article on choosing hospitals and doctors for cancer, heart and other serious ailments

docs.lead_paragraph: A protracted and bitter strike by 115 workers for one of the largest private trash collection companies in the region, serving 10,000 businesses in New York City and Westchester County, has entered its fourth month and is drawing increased scrutiny from public officials.

headline.main: As Tension Grows, So Does Scrutiny of Long Strike by Trash Workers
headline.print_headline: As Tension Grows, So Does Scrutiny of Long Strike by Trash Workers

docs.lead_paragraph: Advocates contended that Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton suggested she supports their agenda without taking a firm public stand on a divisive issue.

headline.main: Clinton's Remark on Ruling Irks Gay Rights Advocates
headline.print_headline: Clinton's Remark on Ruling Irks Gay Rights Advocates

docs.snippet: Advocates contended that Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton suggested she supports their agenda without taking a firm public stand on a divisive issue.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton sidestepped the controversy over gay marriage in New York yesterday, reiterating her support for gay civil unions and calling for ''full equality for people in committed relationships'' after the state's highest court rejected marriage rights for same-sex couples. Mrs. Clinton's remarks, which made no specific mention of gay marriage, disappointed and even angered some gay rights advocates, who are now recruiting political leaders to push a gay marriage bill through the State Legislature.

headline.main: Clinton's Remark on Ruling Irks Gay Rights Advocates

docs.abstract: New York Sen Hillary Rodham Clinton's remarks that she supports gay civil unions and calling for full equality for people in committed relationships angers some gay rights advocates who see remarks by Clinton, who is running for re-election, as sidestepping term gay marriage; remarks follow ruling by New York Court of Appeals that lawmakers, not courts, should decide issue; New York Sen Charles E Schumer also says that he supports civil unions and that lawmakers, not courts, should decide issue; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: INSURER DISCUSSES BID FOR AMERUS -- Aviva, the largest insurance company in Britain, said it was in talks to buy the AmerUs Group, an insurance company based in Iowa, in a deal that would increase its presence in the American market. AmerUs, of Des Moines, confirmed the talks but said there was no assurance a transaction would result. The company provides life insurance and annuity products and has a market capitalization of $2.4 billion.
